entry.title: pie made from lampreys (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that on special occasions, the city of Gloucester supplies a pie made from lampreys (lamprey pictured) to the British monarch?

entry.title: Sagrada (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in the board game Sagrada, players attempt to construct a stained-glass window using dice?

entry.title: Nisvan Erkal (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that economist Nisvan Erkal's research showed that China's one-child policy created children who lacked qualities important for social and economic success?

entry.title: Herr, gib uns Mut zum Hören (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that all stanzas of the 1963 song "Herr, gib uns Mut zum Hören" (Lord, give us courage to listen), with text and tune by Kurt Rommel, begin with a prayer for courage?

entry.title: Charlie Green (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that College Football Hall of Fame quarterback Charlie Green led Wittenberg to three consecutive undefeated seasons, including a national championship for the 1964 Wittenberg Tigers football team?

entry.title: I Know (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Seo Taiji and Boys's April 11, 1992, performance of "I Know" is credited as the beginning of modern K-pop?

entry.title: Jonathan Roumie (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that actor Jonathan Roumie, who plays the character of Jesus Christ in American television series The Chosen, is also an extraordinary minister of Holy Communion in the Catholic Church?

entry.title: Falcon Lake Incident (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Falcon Lake Incident is considered "Canada's best-documented UFO case"?
